isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - TRANSMISSION SHIFT SELECTOR (420)

svcproc.title: TRANSMISSION SHIFT SELECTOR (420)
svcproc.para: The WTEC III electronic shift selector is the microprocessor that communicates the driver input to the WTEC III ECU. The transmission shift selector (420) receives battery power at all times (ignition key on or off) from the WTEC III ECU (634) over circuit 136C, connector (418) and circuit 136C. The shift selector (420) is grounded through circuit 143A, connector (418), and circuit 143A to the WTEC III ECU (634).
Shift selector connector (420) pins A, B, C, D, and E provide a communication path between the shift selector and the ECU.
